intro: Xanthobrychis, commonly known as the yellow moss, is a genus of liverworts belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically green to yellowish in color. These plants thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rocks. Xanthobrychis species are typically non-vascular, relying on spores for reproduction rather than seeds. Their structure and growth patterns make them important indicators of environmental conditions in their habitats.
